page.title: 02Lady K Leveson School
page.content: Lady Katherne Leveson,a daughter of the Earl of Dudley,died in 1674 leaving all her estates, including Temple Balsall, to trustees to erect and endow a free school for twenty poor boys from Balsall .The first Head Master was Robert Chamberlain and the first school boys came in the year 1679. The first School was in what is now the Prayer Room in the Almshouses. In the year 1876 the old part of the present buildings were built. They are now classes two, four and the Library. They were Upper and Lower Infant and Upper and Lower Junior. The hall and old Staff room were built in the early 60s. The newest building dates from 1981. We have six teachers, and four classes at present for 100 children.
